speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about when these symptoms started? Was it sudden or did they develop gradually?"

speaker: Patient
text: "It started this morning, I'd say. I woke up feeling pretty normal, but then I started feeling like the room was spinning and I got a bit nauseous. It's been going on for a few hours now, but like I said, it's pretty low-grade."

speaker: Doctor
text: "When did you first notice the symptoms were present, and did anything trigger them?"

speaker: Patient
text: "To be honest, I wasn't really paying attention to it at first, but I think it might have started a bit after I went out for a walk yesterday. I had eaten a pretty big meal and also had some garlic for lunch, which I remember now was a few days ago when I was trying to shake off this cold I had."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so it seems like the symptoms started a few weeks ago. Can you walk me through a typical day for you, especially regarding when these symptoms occur? Are they constant or do they come and go?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, it's pretty hard to pinpoint a specific time of day or situation when it happens. It's just something I feel, you know? Sometimes it's worse in the morning, and it seems to get a bit better throughout the day, but it's always there, just a lingering feeling."

speaker: Doctor
text: "When you say they started a few weeks ago, can you pinpoint any specific day or event that might have marked the beginning of these symptoms?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I'm not really sure. Like I said, it started this morning, and it feels like it's just been a gradual build-up over the past few days, maybe even a week or so. I don't think there was a specific event or day that stands out as a trigger, it just feels like it's always been there, really."

speaker: Doctor
text: So, you're saying the symptoms started a few weeks ago, and you can't pinpoint a specific day or event that triggered them. Can you tell me more about your daily activities and how they might be contributing to these symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's pretty simple, I just work, go home, eat, sleep, and repeat. Nothing out of the ordinary, just the usual stuff. I'm pretty active, I exercise a few times a week, but I don't think that's contributing to this, I've been doing it for years without any issues."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me about your medications, including any new ones you've started recently, and whether you've noticed any changes in your dosage?

speaker: Patient
text: "Oh, I take diphenhydramine for sleep and occasional nausea, but I only take it when I need it. I've actually taken it a few times this week, especially since I've been feeling a bit off. It seems to help alleviate my symptoms, but I'm not sure if it's causing them or just masking them."
